page.title: 02A TYPICAL FAMILY SATURDAY
page.content: ON SATURDAY MY DAD WAKES ME UP AND I GO DOWNSTAIRS FOR BREAKFAST. I USUALLY HAVE CEREAL AND A CUP OF COFFEE. AFTER WARDS I GET WASHED AND DRESSED AND FEED MY GERBIL. NEXT I FIND MY VIOLIN AND MUSIC AND GO OUT TO THE CAR. HELEN, MY NEIGHBOUR, JOINS MY BROTHER JAMES AND ME AND WE ARE DRIVEN TO NAILSWORTH WHERE I PLAY IN THE SOUTH GLOS. SCHOOLS' ORCHESTRA. I AM IN THE SECOND VIOLINS. AFTER PLAYING FOR TWO AND A HALF HOURS I MEET HELEN AND JAMES WHO HAVE BEEN PLAYING FLUTE AND RECORDER AND WE GO HOME FOR LUNCH. IN THE AFTERNOON I GO TO WOTTON POOL FOR SWIMMING, OR PLAY IN THE BACK GARDEN. IN THE EVENING I WATCH TELEVISION. EMMA CORDWELL AGE 11
